messages: ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:53): Someone less lazy than me should suggest proposing <meta name="designed-for-specs" content="http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/"> or content="http://www.w3.org/TR/2009/WD-html5-20090825/ http://www.w3.org/TR/2009/WD-rdfa-in-html-20091015/" etc
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:53): instead of trying to squeeze the information needlessly into the most complex syntactic feature of HTML5 with the most compatibility problems
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (15:55): I can't play this "You're wrong", "That's your opinion", "You're wrong that it's an opinion" game with Shelley for too long.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:55): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: Can you stop filling up that mailbox
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:56): It seems unlikely to be productive to say "You're wrong" to people

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (15:56): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: And when they're actually wrong?  And keep saying things that are wrong, and using those wrong things as justification for their arguments?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:56): Better to just state your arguments and reasoning, and trust that reasonable people will agree with you if you're right
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (15:56): It's really hard to see what one can do except point out, "Uh, yeah, here are examples proving you wrong."
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:56): (and trust that reasonable people will determine what goes in the spec)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:57): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: It's not clear that the processed is biased in that way
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (15:57): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Sorry, but to be fair, I'm not the largest source of emails on that thread.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:58): looks at the thread again
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:58): Oh, Shelley already basically said what I just said

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (15:58): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: It's just impossible to actually *argue* with someone who is saying things that are demonstrably wrong.  If you don't correct them, then *at best* you're shouting over them and hoping to reach the choir.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (15:59): You could just ignore it
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:59): So don't waste so much effort trying to argue with them :-)
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (15:59): has now got 56 messages in 18 hours or so
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:00): s/argue with/respond to/
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:00): From that bug

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:02): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: Yeah, I could.  But then I'd have to address the arguments later on when they start wielding the process like a hacksaw.  And in the meantime it's possible that people are swayed over to the wrong side due to them not realizing that there are false arguments being employed.

b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:04): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: You may as well ignore all bugs. Eventually the controversal ones will all get turned into change proposals at which point they have to be unignored
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:05): Nothing you say upfront can possibly prevent that happening
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:05): Can quirks mode trigger parsing changes?  That is, can a page produce a different DOM based on which mode it's in?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:05): yes
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (16:05): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: Yes, there is one difference
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:05): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: Sigh, I guess you're right.  But they're Wrong On The Internet.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:06): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: Suggestion made.

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (16:10): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb, the process doesn't require anyone to talk to each other.  If the group doesn't come to consensus, you just have to write the proposals to convince the chairs, as far as I can tell.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:11): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: Sure, it doesn't require it.  But discussion is the whole point of having a list.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (16:12): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb, well, no.  Getting a better spec is the point of having the list.  Discussion is only a means to an end.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:12): Sorry, I'll clarify.  Discussion is typically a vital part of producing a better spec.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (16:22): Some types of discussion are.  Some discussion is just noise.
40cddb5ac261f4694179715cd8424278 (16:25): I can't believe there's actually a suggestion to allow iframe in figure, but not directly allow tables/code/etc in there...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:27): currently those are allowed
40cddb5ac261f4694179715cd8424278 (16:28): I know, I'm reading the bug that wants to disallow them
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:28): oh that
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (16:30): is "-//H//T M//L" a legal FPI?
40cddb5ac261f4694179715cd8424278 (16:30): I just stared in disbelief when I saw "another option would be to allow iframe"...
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (16:31): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46, does it matter?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (16:32): in other news the secret xml-stylesheet draft will hopefully soon be published as a FPWD
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:32): 40cddb5ac261f4694179715cd8424278: Where was <iframe> suggested? (I only remember <object>)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:33): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: I think not, but I haven't a copy of the spec here
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:33): Oh, in the bug
40cddb5ac261f4694179715cd8424278 (16:33): http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=8404#c28 "Another option is to add one more element: iframe"
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (16:33): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: why? because "L" is not a legal language tag?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (16:34): or is "NONSGML" an allowed string and "T" is not?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (16:35): wants to see what happens when some of these Change Proposals actually get past the bureaucratic machinery and get resolved
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:35): I usually use "figure" to express the semantics "this would cross over a column/page break if I inserted it inline"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (16:35): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: http://xml.coverpages.org/tauber-fpi.html
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (16:38): public_text_class =
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (16:38): CAPACITY | CHARSET | DOCUMENT | DTD | ELEMENTS | ENTITIES | LPD | NONSGML | NOTATION | SHORTREF | SUBDOC | SYNTAX | TEXT
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:38): Use "-////TEXT HT//ML"
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (16:40): Maltese?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:40): Malayalam
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:40): obviously
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:40): Oh, how confusing
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:41): http://www.w3.org/WAI/ER/IG/ert/iso639.htm puts ml next to Maltese in the 3-letter section
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:41): but it's MT in the 2-letter section
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:42): Guess that's a bug in the W3C page
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:45): Anyway, I guess it doesn't matter since Maltese and Malayalam are equally accurate descriptions of the markup language
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (16:53): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: had any luck writing a change proposal of your own?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (16:53): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342, no, nothing much I want changed that the editor doesn't.
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (16:54): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: I mean the counter-proposal, the "empty change proposal" as it were
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (16:54): I haven't tried writing one yet.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (16:54): I've thought of it, but I don't have the time to do it justice, and am not really the most qualified person on any given issue that I've seen.
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (16:55): sorry, I'm being a retard, I mistook you for 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb just ehn

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (16:55): I'm mostly interested in what will happen when people figure out that the HTMLWG is more or less just a dictatorship of the chairs instead of the editor, in the end.  Just with a lot more politics and bureaucracy.
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (16:55): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: Easy mistake to make, since they're both CamelCase names

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:56): 66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342: Sorry, I was at work until 10pm last night raging against this server.  I"m doing final troubleshooting with our network admin before we wipe the fucker and start over.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:56): It's planned for lunch today instead.
66b0d785bfa15d051888c24dabba7342 (16:56): haha, we can always request a new deadline in a week if things are too busy
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (16:56): If necessary, I'll do that.  But I think I can get it out today.
